page.title: 10Boskenwyn 1913-1927 cont
page.content: Children who stayed for lunch warmed pasties on the stoves, others walked home. The desks had bench seats for two with holes for inkwells. The children wrote in exercise books, seldom painted but did some detailed drawing.There were maps on the walls. The teacher had a cane which she used often. Playground games included marbles,spinning tops,tig,leapfrog and rolling hoops:metal for the boys and wooden for the girls. They made popguns with ramrods which fired pellets, and whistles made from sycamore.
